name: Ludolph's number, or Pi number.
instruction:
![](https://course-qa-basics.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/section-2-course-2-task-3.png)

Pi is a mathematical constant expressing the ratio of the length of a circle to the length of its diameter.
There is an obsolete name for the number Pi: the Ludolph number, but this name is hardly used anymore.
Mathematicians still continue to discover new digits of this infinite number.
The approximate value of Pi is 3.1415.

Create a constant named `pi` and assign it the value `3.1415`.

Here is an example that is fundamentally similar to what you need to do,
but adapt it to the requirements of the task:
```javascript
const si = 3.878323;
```
